title: 105_hr2949
content: MISSOURI AND MIDDLE MISSISSIPPI RIVERS ENHANCEMENT PROJECT. The section defines key terms like "middle Mississippi River" and "Missouri River" and outlines the project authorized by the Secretary of the Army for protection and enhancement activities. The Secretary shall develop a plan for a project to protect and enhance fish and wildlife habitat of the Missouri River and the middle Mississippi River, ensuring activities do not adversely affect water-related needs or private property rights. The plan for the project includes modification and improvement of navigation training structures, creation of side channels, restoration of island habitat, creation of riverine habitat, and establishment of criteria. The plan for the project includes modification and improvement of navigation training structures, creation of side channels, restoration of island habitat, creation of riverine habitat, establishment of criteria for prioritizing activities, and physical and biological monitoring for evaluating success. Implementation of activities will be carried out by the Secretary using available funds. The Secretary may design and construct project features to accelerate activities for fish and wildlife habitat protection on the Missouri River or middle Mississippi River, integrating them with other Federal and State activities. The Secretary has the authority to carry out the project for mitigation of fish and wildlife losses on the Missouri River, integrating with other Federal and State activities. This does not affect existing authorities for the Missouri River Bank Stabilization and Navigation Project or other relevant authorities. The Secretary has the authority to carry out the project for mitigation of fish and wildlife losses on the Missouri River, integrating with other Federal and State activities. This does not confer any new regulatory authority on any entity. Public participation is required in developing and carrying out the plan, including advance notice of meetings and maintaining appropriate records. Compliance with applicable law is necessary for carrying out the activities. The Secretary must comply with applicable Federal laws, including the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969. The non-Federal share of project costs should not exceed 25%, with the Federal share capped at $5,000,000 per activity. Operation and maintenance of the project are the Federal responsibility. Authorization of appropriations is provided for the Federal share of project costs. The Federal government will provide $50,000,000 for activities from 1999 to 2004, managed by the Mississippi Valley Division of the Army Corps of Engineers.
